website_summaries.verdict: Adding LTE to the consumer version of the Surface Pro is a convenient but expensive alternative to tethering from a smartphone.
pros: The best-in-class Surface Pro keeps all its best features, and adds an LTE antenna for always on internet connectivity
cons: Only two consumer configurations are available with LTE, the excellent keyboard cover and Surface Pen are still sold separately

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE - Check your processor
customer_reviews.text: Great machine - if you're not scammed. I purchased a Surface Pro with the i5 Processor from the seller 'Electronics, Toys, and Games.' It came in a shrink-wrapped box that looked legitimate - the box had a serial number, as well as the model (i5). I happened to be running some diagnostics and noticed the processor is not an i5, but an m3 - almost $300 less in value. I would not have noticed otherwise. Furthermore, the serial number did not match the box - absolutely fraudulent. PLEASE be sure to check your specs and serial number before you do anything, and DO NOT buy from 'Electronic, Toys, and Games'!
customer_reviews.author: Mika

customer_reviews.title: SCREEN FLICKER ISSUES
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Surface Pro 4, which had a screen flickering issue that developed after about 1 year of use. This is a well known issue and many angry customers have voiced their experiences online (search "Flickergate"). So, after about 2 months of light use of my new Surface Pro, the same problem is happening again. The screen flickering issue has not been fixed in the new model.
customer_reviews.author: Betty L.

customer_reviews.title: I don't think I'll go back to a regular laptop ever again.
customer_reviews.text: The main advantages of this over a laptop are the smaller size, fully Windows compatible, and better battery life over a tablet. I recommend getting the type cover and Surface Pen to really use the Surface to its full capabilities. This is my first Surface Pro and the pen absolutely is worth it; it's very intuitive for sketching and jotting down notes. Even for browsing it feels more natural than a mouse or touchpad. This thing is an absolute pleasure to use, and the fan-less i5 core is speedy and quiet. It charges relatively quickly, but a USB-C connection for faster charges would make it even better.
customer_reviews.author: James Newkirk

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I have bought many ultra books, tablets, laptops etc. and always had an element of disappointment. This is the first tablet/ laptop I have bought that has exceeded my expectations. When detached from the keyboard it really is a fine tablet and when attached to the keyboard is a good laptop for travel or occasional use in the home. I would not go as far as saying that it replaces my desktop (2 Hi Res screens etc.) but it comes closer than anything I have had before. Very fast, light and easy to transport with good battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Mike F

customer_reviews.title: It's great, mostly
customer_reviews.text: A great purchase. I just love the light weight and how quickly it boots up. Also the gorilla glass it major improvement over the older models. Still, I was hoping to get some place to put the pen. I mean really, it just does not work to have it stuck to the side of the screen. It is always getting knocked off and that pen is not cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cooley

customer_reviews.title: I got a faulty product
customer_reviews.text: When I got my laptop it turned on once and I was able to get my Google file up and running. When to use it a second time and the windows symbol came up and won't go away. Very frustrating. I tried everything it said on the Windows site and it still won't go away. I got a defective product. No wonder it was so heavily discounted.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: The preformance you get in this small package is amazing, and there is the ability to play certain ...
customer_reviews.text: Had a surface pro 3 i5 edition, decided it was time to upgrade so I chose the new surface pro with an i7. The preformance you get in this small package is amazing, and there is the ability to play certain games on this machine such as Skyrim, however I've noticed the device does not charge while doing cpu intensive tasks, might have something to do with the 15 watt power supply. Over all very solid and great machine, priced on the high end but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: has a beautiful screen, boots up quickly and runs quite fast
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Surface Pro unit. I upgraded from a Surface 3 to a Surface 4 to the 2017 Surface Pro. All were i7 tablets and I had no issues with any of them. This one, as the others, has a beautiful screen, boots up quickly and runs quite fast. It's definitely the best of the three I've owned. This is my go to travel unit due to it's size and weight. I also purchased a new alcantra keyboard which also works quite well. It's a little pricey but worth it to me because of it versatility. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Sweet device, nicer price than those fruit guys
customer_reviews.text: As usual, the Windows experience is quirky. If you're coming from Apple, you'll notice it. I like the expanded functionality of the Pro tablet. I'm using the Surface Pro cover, and run AutoCAD LT 2018 with a 27" 4k monitor off this little wonder and am quite pleased with the performance. Windows tends to lose peripherals, and does so but not too bad. So I fault the OS for this and not the tablet. Also, at the price, this is a very spendy tablet and is much more of a full featured PC (sans drives and slots). Runs cool. Has great battery life. Highest resolution per inch of any tablet I've used so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Ricca

customer_reviews.title: Must Know Info
customer_reviews.text: If you have any blue screen problems at all (BSOD), go to the Microsoft store and download the Surface Diagnostic Toolkit. That is your new best friend. Also, any time you have a problem... do a double restart-restart twice.
customer_reviews.author: Live and Learn

customer_reviews.title: The 2017 Surface Pro = Best in Show!
customer_reviews.text: I'm too excited to write a proper review right now. Let me just say that I went to Frye's, Best Buy, and Walmart to touch, play with, and see the new iPad, Surface Pro, Samsung Tablets, etc. I even watched several comparison videos on YouTube and.... AM SO HAPPY WITH THE SURFACE PRO 👏👏👏 Nothing beats the quality, features, and size for the price. I'll update this review after I've really had a chance to create some graphics on it. ✌😎
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great but overheats
customer_reviews.text: I love it, the versatility of a tablet, but strength of a PC. The only reason I gave it three stars, is because (at-least mine) has an overheating problem. The fans seem to not cool it fast enough, the thing gets so hot that it will freeze from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Jabz

customer_reviews.title: Very responsive and fast.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third PRO. Hello works great with this version, even in a darken room. Very responsive. I use for Lightroom CC and Photoshop CC and it works great. Able to down load RAW files very fast and do Post processing when in the field. I am very impressed with the build quality of the tablet. Has a USB port that will work with a hub. Also can connect to a TV through a cable adapter and HDMI to watch shows on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Trent Allen

customer_reviews.title: The Surface Pro i7 is great
customer_reviews.text: Love this Surface Pro. Bought it for artwork, but I use it for almost everything. Boots quickly, decent battery life, impressive when paired with the surface pen. Gets warm when playing video games (Starcraft II and Diablo III), but it runs them well! Did not expect to use it for gaming, but I am. Good precision with the surface pen. Really love drawing on it. Highly recommend the i7 18gb.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t justify the cost
customer_reviews.text: Really dissatisfied with the operating system, lots of weird problems in getting it to boot up sometimes. Then it will be fine for a while, then have problems again, for example, trying to do a hard shut down, the screen will say, “Pull down to shut down,” but it’s never responded. Other drawbacks of having a Microsoft device is that it makes non-Windows compete products not work at all. For example, you can’t auto save to either Dropbox or Google Drive, just OneDrive. I like the light weight and occasionally use as a tablet, but considering the price tag, wouldn’t do it again.
customer_reviews.author: utstrucken

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations. This is the best tablet 2-in-1 on the market. Apple who?
customer_reviews.text: I use my SP for everything including writing code, watching Netflix, watching NFL, reading via the Windows Kindle app, making notes in OneNote, editing video in Adobe Premiere Pro. Never had any significant issues. The specs (CPU / RAM, etc) combined with this amazing form factor is the best. Under heavy use, I'd guess I get 4 hours of battery. I regularly have it docked so it rarely gets below 50% battery.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dilts

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: A bit disappointed the new edition doesn't come with the pen, had to order one on preorder. So far it's been great, everything functions well, and so far no troubles like the 4 had with the display.
customer_reviews.author: Tonja B.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: This surface is small fast and a great laptop replacement. Easy to setup, fast boot and everything works great. Very pleased with this purchase. The only issue I have had is the battery it is awesome for movies ( 2 hour movie only uses ~15% of a battery), but when using it in a meeting (Wifi, screen, typing...) the battery life is significantly less. Maybe 6- 7 hours at most. I was hoping I could used it all day and then on the airplane home but that is a stretch. I will play with the settings but have them set now so I should be getting close to maximum life.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Fun

customer_reviews.title: It's great as a science major because most of my lectures ...
customer_reviews.text: This has quickly become my everyday note-taking tool. It's great as a science major because most of my lectures are powerpoint/picture/diagram based. Integration with OneNote makes this machine an impeccable tool for excellent performance in these classes. If you're looking for something to invest in to improve your college experience, this is exactly you're looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Payton Law

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Little disappointed as I sprung for the i7 over the m5 and now wondering if it made a difference. It gets super hot and often chokes if more than two applications are running. Also forget about running a large file in photoshop or manga studio, it will crash so fast it's not even funny
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: I have have decided to rethink the Windows line-up. Although, I really wanted the Surface Book, I had to return ALL 3 due to hardware & firewall issues; therefore, I decided to try the Surface Pro 5th edition and have encountered the same issues. I'm disappointed in Windows products at this point, because after sending literally HOURS on phone, with them having remote access, they got to use the computer more than me. I have no confidence that Windows knows their own product to fix issues that arise.
customer_reviews.author: TINA TIBBS

customer_reviews.title: Surface
customer_reviews.text: I love the surface. it is a beautiful, light tablet running a full windows pro operating system with a great display. There are a few quirks though: First is that the power and volume buttons are configured for up-ended use rather than use with the keyboard (not horrible but just kind of awkward and confusing difference from my old surface), next, with the keyboard in it's standard angled position it is really close to the taskbar which can make using touch just ever so slightly more difficult and lastly (though I knew this going in) it doesn't come with the pen like the original surfaces did. But any of these are just minor quirks, I absolutely love the device.
customer_reviews.author: A Person

customer_reviews.title: So far I love it
customer_reviews.text: So far I love my new computer. I probably should have gotten one with more memory, but the cost was not in my budget. I added an external hard drive to expand the capability without spending too much. I think this is going to work out fantastically. The size and light weight of the Surface Pro make it great for taking along on trips.
customer_reviews.author: Robin S.

customer_reviews.title: I bought this 4 months ago and now it doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: Bought 4 months ago and now there are hard ware issues with bluetooth. I updated all the drivers and software and the Bluetooth feature wil cut in and out. Tried to return to vendor and my window has closed. Tried to open a warranty claim w microsof and it says my warranty ended in 8/2020. I did not buy a refurbed device..... I just bought in march form this vendor and now I am stuck with an expensive piece of crap. WILL NOT buy from this vendor again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Stover

customer_reviews.title: Very nice... but you can't repair these
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son in college. He uses it as a mash-up tool so that he can edit PDF files during lectures and such. He says that it is very good. My only problem with the product is that it is 100% NOT fixable. If you break a screen, have a connector go out, batteries start to degrade, etc, you are completely out of luck. It is impossible to take this tablet apart and fix it. Welcome to the 21st century of disposable products, something I hate.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Einstein

customer_reviews.title: this is one fantastic device. I am extremely pleased
customer_reviews.text: After a little over a week of use, this is one fantastic device. I am extremely pleased. Perfect size for portability along with usability, at least for my purposes. Great screen resolution and seems to run every bit as fast as my Intel i7 powered HP desktop.
customer_reviews.author: D. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Love my Surface Pro!
customer_reviews.text: This was an upgrade from the Surface Pro 3 and is exactly what I was hoping it would be! Not a drastic change overall, but a solid computing machine. Windows 10 and the Surface family of products have really made Microsoft relevant again. I've not had any issues with blue screens or battery drain. Touch input is great. Would definitely buy again and recommend to others!
customer_reviews.author: S. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Craftsmanship bar none!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful to look at, beautiful to hold and a wonderful working experience. The Surface Pro is certainly a laptop to behold. You will get complimentary stares and comments everywhere you use the device. The experience from unboxing to setting up is exceptional... though like with all devices the updates are painful. Only negative is that the Surface Pro keyboard and pen needs to be purchased separately, but there's enough gripe on the internet about this point - though I think it goes unnoticed by Microsoft. Nonetheless, if you take the plunge, you will have to get the keyboard and depending on what you intend using the device for, the pen is really optional.
customer_reviews.author: Warren_Larkan

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome upgrade to say the least
customer_reviews.text: My surface pro 3 began showing signs of failure after a few of years of hard service. This is an awesome upgrade to say the least. Exact same specs as the unit it replaced but this new Surface pro is smooth as butter and the fanless cooling is also a very nice upgrade. The surface pro 3 was not terribly noisy under a load but as they say silence is golden. It seems like Microsoft catches a fair amount of negativity, but they sure make a tablet that is a rock solid laptop alternative.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: Do not hesitate in buying this pc . It is so much more practical in the business world when you’re constantly on the go, not having to slug around a full size laptop. Get the premium keyboard and pen with this laptop. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Machine and Experience.
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant before buying it because everybody said it was a tablet and it was similar to IPad Pro. Well let me tell you that the machine is looking waaay slimmer than other laptops in it's range and here I was comparing it most with Dell XPS 13". Working for a banking institution I'm using it to finish my reports at home and also work during weekend on it and I am super delighted to work on it being so easy to carry around and use. The power it's also great never had any errors or troubles with it. I like it a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Andreas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Replacement for my Old Laptop
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new laptop and wanted something with a touch screen I can write on and I couldn't be happier with the Surface. It runs windows 10, which is the operating system I prefer. The SSD starts up super fast. It's incredibly light. The screen looks great. The accessories are a bit pricey (unless you compare to apple) but I bought the keyboard, pen, and fold able mouse for Surface and I'd recommend them all. The mouse is very optional but very cool and useful, but the trackpad on the keyboard works just as well as any other modern trackpad. I'd recommend the Surface for anyone who carries a laptop around daily for school or work.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like the laptop
customer_reviews.text: I really like the laptop. Like the weight, and the size and how everything holds together, the keyboard is great the pen attaches to it. Powerful enough for what I need it. Runs photoshop well too on the M3. Happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: Only usable as a touch screen - keyboards are lousy
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a Mac Book with it. Was happy for about the first 4 months, then the keyboard wore out, have bought two more since. They all work upon receipt and then fail to be usable within a few months. the mouse is a joke and miscues constantly, making the machine useless except for as a touch screen pad....Don't waste your money if you plan to use it as a business machine and do any publishing, spread sheet or keyboard centric work
customer_reviews.author: FireRock

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price and won't buy anything else....also get the insurance!
customer_reviews.text: It's been a couple months since I bought mine and I can't imagine now why I had anything else! It's light, easy to use, easy to switch between tablet/laptop and vice versa. Fits perfectly in all of my bags and has a decent battery life. Even got my husband to buy one when he switched jobs and he loves his. Also the insurance is so much cheaper/covers more than best buy and for longer. It was also cheaper than buying it in store.
customer_reviews.author: Wvuchic13707

customer_reviews.title: Windows update bricked the computer
customer_reviews.text: It was great ... while it worked! then a windows 10 software update installed and I literally couldn't even start the machine anymore. The only good thing was that I had just bought it so I returned for a refund. Microsoft's unsecure and unstable software managed to destroy hardware that they themselves designed. This isn't the first problem I've had with a surface pro. I sent 2 back previously for screen problems and being too slow. I'm done with this brand forever. I recommend any other 2 in 1 or else an iPad pro
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Morris

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I tried to make the switch from MacBook to the Microsoft Surface Pro, but I keep going back to my MacBook. I had issues with the email app on Windows, so I had to continue using my phone to check my email. Also, the Surface Pro isn't ideal if you like to sit with a laptop actually on your lap. Overall, I'm just not that happy with the Surface Pro. Wish I could return it, but I'm past the return window, so now I'm stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Allison W.

customer_reviews.title: Several bright spots appeared on the screen
customer_reviews.text: At first I was happy to get such a versatile device. Later, numerous bugs started to occur in the system: e.g. without rhyme or reason lost menu for closing applications, or the computer is frozen, showing a bright mess of colors on the screen... But the last straw was the appearance of small bright dots on the screen after a couple of months using this device. They are not dead pixels since they don't disappear when switching colors, seems like a trouble with back light.
customer_reviews.author: Yevgeniy Son

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for law student
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this computer. I bought it prior to my first semester in law school. I waited until after first semester to write a review to see how it held up to daily use. It is still going strong. It also works well with the glitchy ExamSoft software we are required to use for exams. The battery life is fantastic. Although I brought my charger to class every day, I only had to charge the computer when I got home at night.
customer_reviews.author: smath

customer_reviews.title: Rocking my world
customer_reviews.text: What can I say more, it is working great. I am a gamer and it is OK, good enough for me, but I don't play FPS's though. Super multi-threaded processing, I can do several tasks (algorithms, processes, etc.) all at one time with minimal performance degradation. Touch screen is a little sensitive to touch, sometimes touching where I don't want. But overall, meets my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Landru

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Received a faulty charger from this company that wasn't working so I contacted the company and was sent another cheap Chinese defective charger. At first I thought it was the surface pro that was the issue until I decided to go to geek squad to check it. They determined it was the charger. So I bought the Microsoft charger and it worked. I almost returned the laptop. Note that this company does charge you a restocking fee if they find the laptop is working fine. That's why I wanted to be sure the issue wasn't the computer. Also I did research the company reviews and the they were bad.
customer_reviews.author: JoeC

customer_reviews.title: Requires further expenditures for full service.
customer_reviews.text: I like the ease of use and the portability. I did need to buy a docking station, a separate connector for my monitor, and a DVD drive. Works nicely with my wireless ScanSnap and wireless Brother printer. Windows 10 made quick work of setting up the wireless connections. I am still staggering from the money bleed, but in a year, I think I will be hooked. You can use a current keyboard and mouse so you don't have to buy the type cover (but I did).
customer_reviews.author: Musette

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I like the Surface Pro a lot more than I thought I would. I had random Hibernation problems the first few weeks, but Microsoft has updated and I do not have the issue any more. Great for travel.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Buy a Surface Already
customer_reviews.text: I regret buying a model that doesn't include a type C port, but other than that, this baby works like a dream. I use it as an ultraportable between school and work. I also use the cobalt surface pen to write on the screen while I tutor students over the internet. The battery usually lasts me a week if I use it lightly and shut it down between uses. The hardware isn't for gamers, but it runs Cuphead perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: very nice and responsive
customer_reviews.text: have had this for a week and so far i like it a lot. i bought this to do my school stuff when i cant be on my PC. only bad thing i can say about it is no USB C. 1x USB A and a display adapter which i have never used before. if you want more USB ports then i suggest getting a USB hub. Overall very nice machine. it is very responsive and very light. the windows hello is a cool feature that I've never used before and pretty sure the government has my face now LOL.
customer_reviews.author: albert henderson

customer_reviews.title: Nice while it worked (six weeks)
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a nice little lightweight computer for traveling. After having it about six weeks I took it to France and after two days it refuses to boot- just shows a Windows logo for 5 sec and goes blank. I tried all the hard reset options- nothing. I'll take it to the Microsoft store and get it dealt with, but for a computer that was practically new this was very unfortunate
customer_reviews.author: dinalol

customer_reviews.title: The best computer It does it all
customer_reviews.text: The best computer It does it all, and is very light weight, and fast. I feel almost all directions are far to complicated, and use too many acronyms. If Henry Ford had given those type of directions with the first cars, the automobile industry would never survived. But this is the best I have had and I have probably had at least a half a dozen in my lifetime..
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT GROVE

customer_reviews.title: Good but still too early to tell.
customer_reviews.text: Using this for base station for stock trading. Purchased the surface docking station, surface mouse and external hard drive to pair up with a couple of external monitors, DVD drive, wireless keyboard and printer. Seems to have enough power to run all the applications I am using so far. Spend the extra $'s for the correct mini display cable, I had display issues with the cheaper cables.
customer_reviews.author: clint

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a classic "you get what you pay for" sort of situation. I purchased the m3 model with 4GB of RAM for a little under $600. This thing is great: it's portable, high-quality, stylish, and seems durable enough, but it's performance lags compared to my other laptops. If I had sprung for the i5 with 8 GB model, I'm sure I would have nothing to complain about, but I couldn't justify pretty much doubling what I was going to spend. Sure, you can't have 18 Chrome tabs open with Excel running while you watch a Twitch Stream--but you can do anything a normal college student would require of a laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Carl F.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. I love the flexibility and portability of this product. I wanted a laptop that was like a tablet and I got just that. I also bought the brydge keyboard that converts the surface pro into a computer, best decision I made in a long time. You will love this product. Seller did a stellar job of getting the item to me timely. However, the i5 processor is a little slow for my taste. I'm coming from a Macbook Pro that was very responsive. I should've followed my first mind and bought a pro with the i7 processor. But all around good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Marquise Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet/Desktop
customer_reviews.text: I bought a surface pro for my wife about a year ago and was so delighted with it, I had to buy one for myself. The facial recognition feature works great. There is hardly any delay between the time the sensor(s) are activated and when you're into the desktop. I'm very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Glitches but great otherwise
customer_reviews.text: While I love my surface pro, especially for academic purposes, I can’t seem to rate this above 3 Stars due to the glitches that occur once in a while. For example, when playing something like Hulu the taskbar will lock itself onto the screen even if I click to full screen the video. Furthermore, sometimes the device just refuses to work forcing me to restart it. Luckily I purchased an extended warranty that will cover the laptop if these glitches further occur. Other than that, this laptop is literally perfect for a college student.
customer_reviews.author: omar alaina

customer_reviews.title: Just fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite computers I have ever owned. Touchscreen is beautiful. Size and weight are perfect for traveling and the pen opens up a whole new world for creative work. Powerful enough to run all my Adobe software. I might never buy a laptop again.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick C.

customer_reviews.title: Love this see below what I like
customer_reviews.text: Skinny. Lightweight. Good lasting battery. Beautiful screen, almost as good as iPad. Watching all my movies from usb Toshiba drive. Audio not too great m, must fiddle with it, but works. Generally speaking I really like it. Only cons are audio - not loud enough and price a bit high. Best tablet I own so far. Definitely recommend to buy
customer_reviews.author: Maia

customer_reviews.title: Windows recommended fixes don't work
customer_reviews.text: Constantly freezing on wake-up with the windows logo displayed. Windows recommended fixes don't work, as usual. Garbage product for the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick

customer_reviews.title: ... that will not update to Win 10 and has terrible battery life
customer_reviews.text: I already have a Surface 3 that will not update to Win 10 and has terrible battery life. But need a Windows 10 laptop/tablet that is light and easy to travel with. I work in IT Service and Support and need to have latest tech with me to support customers. So far I really like this new Surface. Starts up quickly. Has great battery life. And the screen quality is amazing.Next I need to see if I can build a virtual machine on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: It has all the power of a big bulky laptop with the size and weight of a tablet. The keyboard comes in handy when you need to hold a button and drag an object or when you want to sit at a table and type out reviews. I got the pen that goes with it and it works great! You can draw free hand, take hand written notes or draw in AutoCAD, Visio or PowerPoint easier than with a mouse. I’d say size weight and battery life make this the best computer I’ve ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Roberts

customer_reviews.title: amazing pen response- better than my cintiq
customer_reviews.text: fast efficient, amazing pen response- better than my cintiq. runs surprisingly cool for I7 16gb ram model. Just wish it had usb-c but not a deal breaker for me
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Using for 2 years and it's still going strong
customer_reviews.text: Very happy to have this--it's lightweight, so I carry it around the house, in the car, on planes, etc. The battery lasts me several days before needing a recharge even though I just shut the screen down and rarely turn it off. The flexible keyboard takes getting used to. No repairs in 2 years. I don't really use it as a tablet, but just like a laptop, because I like having the page down key on the keyboard when I'm reading online. But you can use the pad instead if you're comfortable with it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Touchscreen stops working very quickly
customer_reviews.text: This product worked fine for a year or so, but almost as soon as the warranty expired, part of the touchscreen an inch wide down the entirety of the screen stopped working - now that part of the screen cannot be used with touch or a pen. Really disappointing and shoddy.
customer_reviews.author: Rohan

customer_reviews.title: Has a screen issue!
customer_reviews.text: Its compact and fast. But has a screen issue, a lot of users have conplainned about the screen flickring.. it does happen
customer_reviews.author: Marcela Langhi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for Work
customer_reviews.text: Great for work. I bought this specifically to support my automation design side gig. It really helps me take notes at customers facilities and record accurate measurements to then turn into 3D models. Now with that being said, it cant support the high end modeling packages. But I wouldnt expect it to. Its a great field tool and will get extensive use. I use it frequently at home to replace my laptop as well. Light games (havent tried more than civ 5), word processing, email, notes, drawing for fun, and that kind of thing.
customer_reviews.author: PurduePete

customer_reviews.title: First one died in two weeks, replacement has no problems
customer_reviews.text: My first one died in two weeks, the replacement has been running well for a year. Love it! Downsides -- replacement charger cord is ridiculously expensive, $70+. Also be very careful which case you buy if you have the fastest processor, some cases labeled as OK for this model will block the vents for the cooling fan resulting in overheating. Slower processor models don't have a cooling fan.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Gustafson

customer_reviews.title: This is worth every $$!
customer_reviews.text: I had the Surface 3 with my previous workplace. I was really underwhelmed by its functionality but loved its features. I didn't buy the luxury version but it still had many shortcomings. My new workplace agreed to purchase the 5 for me and I love it!! It has absolutely made me a loyal surface user! The price point on this to is well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: BAD BATTERY LIFE - KEYBOARD PROBLEMS
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in October 2017, less than two years ago. I'm 81 years old and paid a lot for this unit, thinking I wouldn't need another one. Use at home and travel. It had to be replaced 3 months later because it wasn't working. Now I'm facing battery problems - it goes from 100% to 0 in about an hour and a half but I'm told I'm out of warranty. I understand that but why did the battery die so soon. Also my keyboard doesn't work all the time and I have to remove it an clean the contacts. I thought I was getting top of the line.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall Satisfy, Some Suggestion
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with the laptop/tablet overall. It is very good solid products that may last me at least 5 years. Few suggestions: 1. reduce the weight a little and comparable to iPad tablet 2. move On/Off button to middle of the laptop, the current position (see arrow) create accidental shutdown when moving the position of the screen. 3. add 1 additional usb port. One port is insufficient when we need to move data between two devices. Overall, good job and great product.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Wong

customer_reviews.title: Battery Completely Dead in 2 Years
customer_reviews.text: I will never buy another Surface Pro again - or any Microsoft computer. I have loved this laptop, but the battery is now completely dead after less than 2 years of use. The warranty period for this tablet is 1 year and while Microsoft acknowledges that the battery life is well below expectations they do not consider this to be a defect. The only option available for me today is to receive a $450 refurbished model with the same defective battery and a 90 day warranty...
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Great combination of portability and utility
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my wife who wanted "an iPad". I convinced her to buy a real computer. Now that I have it, I love it so much, we are fighting over who gets to use it :-). Now if I could only convince my boss to get me one of these for work ...
customer_reviews.author: R Mani

customer_reviews.title: Hardware & connectivity issues
customer_reviews.text: The device won't recognize any inputs: no blue tooth, no connected devices, not even a surface keyboard. It managed to function just over 1 year when the device warranty ended. I'm writing this review 1 year and 3 months after purchase. It sustained no severe damage or drops, merely being carried in a book bag daily for 1 year (in a protective case). After hours with tech support and agreeing it was a hardware problem, they still told me they couldn't help. Crap device/seller. Would have rather gotten a Mac.
customer_reviews.author: jacob bush

customer_reviews.title: Lets me get to meetings without losing my desktop setup
customer_reviews.text: I use multiple screens at work. When I detach my laptop from its port the screens all combine to one and I have to reset them when I return to my desk. This has been great to tote to meetings rather than unplugging my laptop from its port and lugging it around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good PROduct
customer_reviews.text: Very nice hybrid laptop/tablet. Convenience and familiarity of Windows with ease of use of a tablet. Time will tell on whether it will meets my wife's work-on-the-go needs.
customer_reviews.author: C. Rollins

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing tablet/pc
customer_reviews.text: After years with an ipad and Samsung Note, this machine rocks. I love this thing. It is literally a pc in a tablet. And MS store people and policy beats apple like a rented mule. I loaded it up with office and all the apps I need, so it really is a copy of my desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Lumby

customer_reviews.title: Best computer I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this computer is better than any Apple I've owned and it works perfectly with my preferred operating system. The Surface Pro is everything that non-Microsoft PCs have failed to be over the years. Windows (as might be expected) works flawlessly with this computer. Do yourself a favor and buy this computer.
customer_reviews.author: WIJIM

customer_reviews.title: great product, but disappointed by battery life
customer_reviews.text: Love the surface I have used it for around 3 months and honestly it ha replaced my laptop altogether, and is so light I dont feel it in my bag, and as law student carrying heavy books all the time; this is important. Is fast and never lags, it does everything I expected. The only disappointment is the battery life which lasts around 6 to 7 hours, since I believed microsoft on the peomise of 13.5 hours which obviously is far from the truth.
customer_reviews.author: luisfont55

customer_reviews.title: Unusable after ONE DAY
customer_reviews.text: Everything was great... Until a day after I started using it. I ordered it brand new and used it for one day and set everything up. Now my hard drive is dead. I took it into the Microsoft store and they said there's basically nothing they could do to fix it. I would expect a lot more out of this for the price I paid...
customer_reviews.author: Jori

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, fast. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Fast, easy to use. Im a full apple user but needed a good portable pc for work since i need some software that only runs on windows. I was considering a macbook with parallels, but the cost, plus software plus the windows license made me look for other options. This is a beautiful machine, fast and simple. No extra software to slow it down, so you get windows at its best. Highly recommend it. Im still an apple user. But credit is given were credit is due.
customer_reviews.author: EJR

customer_reviews.title: Make Sure To Update Fully!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Surface used (i7, 16 GB RAM, 1 TB) and at first, it was hitting some rough patches during set up. A lot of my experiences were easy to look up since others had the same experience: Example - I had to do a soft reset several times before it completed setup. It was having quite a bit of trouble with charging and usage until I updated it fully. Once it was using the latest updates, the Surface started working smoothly and charging properly. It is able to run creative tools well such as Lightroom and works well with Microsoft Suite and Python. I'm hoping this Surface will be a potentially useful traveling computer once we are post-pandemic.
customer_reviews.author: Forrest Baird

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: Not much I can say here. I freaking love this thing (and I was an all Apple person before deciding to buy it).
customer_reviews.author: mcskillet

customer_reviews.title: A great laptop. Nothing batter i have been use before.
customer_reviews.text: A great laptop. Well holds a charge. The sound of the display is so good. Perfect keyboard a touchpad. I recommend to buy. The stylus turned out to be really cool. The quality of the materials and the assembly are exactly one of the best.
customer_reviews.author: Sergey Manakov

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Pretty sure it was brand new. The price was fantastic. I bought this as an intro to digital art. Very pleased! (heads up; good luck changing the lock screen picture)
customer_reviews.author: Klink

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this surface pro! It's not super big and heavy, it's just perfect size. It's also great for school or work. It came in it's original box, sealed and safely packed. I love the charger, it has a magnetic type connection, so as soon as you put it close to the surface pro, it pulls it to connect. Nice! Overall I like it and recommend it! Ps: you don't really need the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: So in love with my Microsoft surface pro
customer_reviews.text: So in love with my Microsoft surface pro! Purchased it brand new and it was on sale for great price and came with case. Couldn't ask for more. This is legit.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Razo

customer_reviews.title: Not up to the mark.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this surface pro, I needed to take a stab at something new yet I didn't enjoyed the exhibition and Windows Os so I returned it back, generally I'm an apple fellow yet at the same time attempted to utilize this yet I didn't loved.
customer_reviews.author: Srikanth

customer_reviews.title: Jesus Christ This Thing is Expensive
customer_reviews.text: But I love it. When I dropped two grand on this thing I was iffy about whether or not I actually needed it that bad but it works so amazingly as a replacement for a laptop that you can use as a tablet. Its all I use apart from my desktop computer now. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Light, and slick
customer_reviews.text: I love this laptop/tablet combo. It is very responsive to touch. the keyboard is great. I love using the pen makes taking notes easy during lectures I open the power point and draw straight on them or write on them. I recommend getting a tempered glass screen protector and a sturdy case for it. I really do like that you can add a memory card to it. Battery lasts hours and hours before needing to be charge.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! I wish I had purchased one MUCH sooner
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! I wish I had purchased one MUCH sooner! In addition to all the great features and ease of use, I especially like that I can keep it powered on during airline flights from gate to gate. It is not considered a "larger portable electronic device," so I do not have to power it down or stow it. This allows me to make good use of all the available on a flight.
customer_reviews.author: Eric W. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive, computer was not i7 actually i5. Check it!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the i7 version, the description, receipt, extended warranty even the box all said i7 but i checked the computer itself and it was an i5. They even swapped the serial #on the box to make it look correct with what was inside. Someone did a good job with packing, looked brandnew. Almost fooled me. It works great but it wasn't what i paid for. Issued a return
customer_reviews.author: Charles Davis

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. I can’t speak highly enough about it. The software and hardware work really well together. Microsoft did a really good job with the touchscreen and with the surface pen, drawling on this thing works really well. This is well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Martin

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I got the I7, 16GB, 512 BG version. Nice bright screen, and great battery life. High performing, and I'm basically using it as my laptop replacement. Work daily with it. Wish there was a USB-C port for charging. That would make it perfect. But it's Microsoft so you'll have to wait for a Pro 7 for that, maybe.
customer_reviews.author: Ellison C.

customer_reviews.title: Stops working after one year and two months. And that not all...
customer_reviews.text: After just a little bit over one year of usage, our Microsoft Surface Pro (5th Gen) froze/stops working and no one pc expert could help. It was more problems while using. The Microsoft mouse stops working in about three months and the keyboard stops working after one month of usage. We throw all away. HUGE disappoint. Such a bad experience for big $.
customer_reviews.author: Cakiee★

customer_reviews.title: its ok
customer_reviews.text: I went with the i5 with 4g ram and 128gb drive. pros: o battery. lasts long enough to do my days quick tasks without a recharge o pen and keyboard accessory. ink, onenote and sketchbook work great o quick setup. was off and running with no issues! o temp. minimal heat during use. cons: o slow. apps get bogged down quick. 4mb ram is not practical in a business environment. o price. its the same logic as why we buy apple stuff. o camera. no flash, low resolution. overall, im ok with the purchase but would recommend more ram and faster processor if you plan on using this as your primary computer. dont cheap yourself for a few hundred.
customer_reviews.author: John O.

customer_reviews.title: Two defective devices
customer_reviews.text: The Microsoft Surface Pro would not connect or stay connected to the internet. I was instructed to bring it to the Microsoft store closest to me, which is 2 hours away. I exchanged it for another device and the same exact thing was wrong with it. I wasted a Saturday at the store and a Sunday morning at home on calls with tech support before I finally gave up and requested a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Braley

customer_reviews.title: Best gift for my lovely wife
customer_reviews.text: This unit was replacing an Asus 2 in 1 tablet with several years in service so my wife is not inexperienced user of this kind of devices. After several months in use she is still excited about how good her Surface Pro is. I had been asking frequently about any cons she could found but still nothing had disliked her and I still receive full credit by the gift selection. So in short, great device for an experience diverse user, and I'm thinking about to get a replacement for my Surface 3.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos De Hermoso

customer_reviews.title: Build Quality, Style and performance.
customer_reviews.text: This is such an epic device to use. Since the day we bought it we have enjoyed it immensely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy It
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of having a tablet and a laptop. This is a perfect combination of the two. Between the stylus and the full fledged Windows OS it does everything you could ask for.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I honestly reccomend. Its fast, the screen is absolutely gorgeous, and keyboard feels amazing 😍. The only issue was that mine had come with windows pro preinstalled. It limited many settings but I was able to resolve it by googling the issue and following a tech support post. After it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Whloop

customer_reviews.title: touch screen died
customer_reviews.text: Bought it right before starting school and it was great until I went on winter break where it stayed in its case/my backpack only for me to turn in on 2 months later and the touch screen no longer worked on the top/left side (depending on how it was being used). Literally waste of money. Tried called support, nothing. I have to pay to replace the entire tablet. extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Morgan

customer_reviews.title: WORTH THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I was unsure about spending this much on the Surface but did it anyways. I could not be more happy with my purchase. I have docking stations at my home and office so I can run two extra screens at a time. The quality and speed are great. No lag between screens. I run two 27inch screens with high quality. Best purchase ever. Iv had this product for two years and have had no problems. I save everything to the cloud so my computer dont get full of junk. Seriously I'm not sure if I said it or not but I'm extremely happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Kolbye Worrell

customer_reviews.title: keyboard does not always open when needed
customer_reviews.text: The software does not always detect when to open the keyboard. This happens in Malwarebytes activation and in the Bible registration process.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Died after a month.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this product for a little over a month and it has already gone dead. Screen won’t come to life, won’t recognize sign in, totally defunct.
customer_reviews.author: Jen K-W
